item.title: All PUBG Update 40.1 PC Patch Notes & Console Release Date
item.content:encoded:
PUBG was one of the first video games to popularise the battle royale format, and it’s still going strong all these years later. In fact, Update 40.1 has just released on PC, and it brings with it a host of new changes.

From map changes to gameplay updates, it’s a juicy patch that’s bound to shake things up. All of the changes made to PUBG with Update 40.1 are listed below, alongside when they’ll come to console.

Biggest PUBG Update 40.1 Changes

Update 40.1 for PUBG makes a lot of changes to the game, but perhaps some of the more notable ones are the World Updates to Erangel. The ruleset is expected to return to normal, though there will be some lingering effects from Erangel: Subzero. Some new features have also been added to the map, such as Destructible Gas Tanks and multiple spawn changes to numerous items.

A new addition is PUBG Bridge, a new website that allows you view 2D match replays directly on the web. All you need to do is log in with your KRAFTON ID, and you’ll be able to view your match history from your linked platforms.

Console players, there’s something specially geared for you, too. A new Virtual Cursor system is finally coming to Consoles, allowing you to navigate the Lobby and menus much more easily.

When Is Update 40.1 Coming To PUBG Console?

Console players can expect the 40.1 Update for PUBG on February 12, eight days after it arrives on PC.

It’s expected to launch at 1 AM UTC, but there will be an eight hour Live Maintenance window, finishing at 9 AM UTC. Once that update window is over, console players can jump right into all of the new content arriving with Update 40.1, and it’s all listed down below.

All PUBG Update 40.1 Patch Notes

World: Erangel

Spawn Changes

  • Erangel: Subzero-specific items and features have been removed.
  • All-In-One Repair Kit, Emergency Cover Flare, and Jammer Pack now spawn in Secret Rooms.

Miscellaneous

  • The Red Zone and ferries have returned.
  • Destructible Gas Tanks have been added.
  • Improved the interior lighting of buildings across the map.

Gunplay

Mk12

  • Damage: 44 → 43
  • Horizontal recoil increased by approximately 8%.

SLR

  • Horizontal recoil decreased by approximately 4%.

Gameplay

UX/UI

We’ve added and improved various UI elements to help players better track information during combat.

Throwable Inventory Display

  • When you pull out or switch a Throwable using a hotkey, a list of your available Throwables and their quantities is displayed in the bottom right of the screen.
    • Up to six types of Throwables are shown, including the currently equipped one.
    • Throwables stored in the Tactical Pack are not included in the display.
    • The inventory list is shown only for a short duration.
    • Not available in Spectator, Replay, or Observer Modes.

Squad Status UI

New status icons and visual feedback allow you to check your squad members’ status at a glance.

  • New icons have been added to display key actions performed by squad members, such as healing, reviving, carrying, and swimming.
    • When interactions occur between squad members, such as healing, reviving, or carrying, the affected squad member’s number is displayed.
    • These new status icons are shown not only in the squad list at the bottom left of the screen, but also on squad member icons displayed on the World Map and Minimap.
    • Not displayed in the squad list while in Observer Mode.
  • New visual effects have been added to the squad list to indicate when squad members are firing.
    • Firing and damage indicators are also visible while spectating squad members.

Blue Zone Alert UI Improvements

Minimap UI and visual effects have been refined to make Blue Zone progression easier to track.

  • New visual cues now signal 1 minute, 30 seconds, and 10 seconds remaining before Play Area restriction.
  • UI elements and visual effects indicating the start of Play Area restriction have been enhanced.
  • New visual effects have been added to indicate phase changes.

Misc.

  • Kill and assist information for each squad member can now be viewed through the Team Management UI when accessing the System Menu in all modes.
  • When using an item, the item icon is now displayed within the timer at the center of the screen.
  • The flight path of Emergency Pickup planes displayed on the World Map has been changed to grayscale.
  • When boarding a vehicle, squad member numbers and colors are now displayed on the vehicle UI.
  • Item pickup messages have been standardized for a more consistent gameplay experience.

Vehicles

  • Improved the animation structure for vehicle drivers and fixed some related issues.

PUBG Bridge

PUBG Bridge connects you to the Battlegrounds. Review your matches and stay on top of your Career.

  • You can now watch 2D Replays outside the game via the new PUBG Bridge website (bridge.pubg.com).
  • After logging in with your KRAFTON ID, you can view the match history from your linked platforms and watch 2D Replays for matches of your choice.
  • From Career – Match History, select a match and click the “View in Browser” button below the 2D Replay to display a QR code. Scanning the QR code allows you to watch the 2D Replay on a mobile device or in a web browser.

Ranked

Season 40

  • Ranked weapon skins for the MG3 have been added as Tier Rewards (permanent) for Season 40. 
  • The leaderboard will reset after the live server maintenance.
  • Check out your final Tier from the previous season through your Career page.
  • Added a UI to show the remaining time for time-limited Tier Rewards.

Regional Ranked Queue Changes

Based on matchmaking conditions in certain regions, we’ve adjusted the available Ranked queues.

Added

  • RU: Duo (TPP), Squad (TPP)
  • NA & SA: Squad (TPP)

Removed

  • NA & SA: Squad (FPP)

Season 39 Rewards

Below are the rewards you’ll be receiving based on your final Tier from the previous Ranked season.

  • The Ranked Parachute skins, weapon skins, and Medals are permanent rewards. The rest of the obtainable rewards are available for use during a single Ranked season.
  • Rewards can be found on your Inventory/Edit Profile page once Season 40 starts.
  • Once Season 40 is over and the server undergoes maintenance, every reward but the Parachute, weapon skin, and Medal will be withdrawn.

(Console) New System: Virtual Cursor

A new Virtual Cursor system is coming to Console, allowing you to navigate the Lobby and menus freely, just like on PC. Move the cursor anywhere on the screen and enjoy intuitive, mouse-like controls directly with your controller!

Key Changes

  • The Virtual Cursor is now available across all menu screens, including the Lobby, Store, Customize, and Career.
  • Use the L-Stick to move the cursor, just like a mouse. Clicking and hovering trigger the same visual effects and sound feedback as on PC.
  • UI layouts for features such as Store browsing, Team Slot management, and Emote customization have been aligned with the PC interface.
  • New shortcuts have been added to improve lobby and menu navigation on Console.

Controls Guide

  • Additional controls and shortcuts for lobby and menu navigation are displayed on-screen through key guides.
  • Press L-Stick (L3) to toggle the cursor speed between fast and slow.
  • While on the Play menu, pressing B (Xbox) or ◯ (PS) will take you directly to the Settings menu.

Notes

  • After returning from the System Menu or the Lobby Action Wheel, the cursor will always reset to the center of the screen at the default speed.
  • Existing interaction methods remain unchanged for text input, platform-specific purchase flows, and the wheel-based controls used in the Lobby Action Wheel.

Workshop

New item sets have been added to the Hunter’s Chest and Archivist’s Chest.

  • Survivor Pass: Steampunk Revival

Special Crafting

Introducing the new Progressive weapon skins and Chromas – craftable only through Special Crafting at the Workshop! Check out the full details on the upcoming Spring Fest 2026 announcement.

Special Crafting Closing Date (UTC)

※ The Special Crafting – Spring Fest 2026 tab will be accessible only until the following dates. Make sure to use up your Tokens before the closing date!

  • PC
    • April 13, 00:00
  • Console
    • April 21, 00:00

Crafter Pass

A brand-new Crafter Pass is prepared for the first festival of the year. Read more details on the Spring Fest 2026 announcement!

Hideout

  • Improved the Contraband Coupon feature to allow players to open up to 10 Contraband Crates at a time.

UX/UI

(PC) New Shortcuts

To align with the introduction of the Virtual Cursor system on Console, we’ve added new shortcuts on PC to make lobby and menu navigation more convenient.

Misc.

  • (PC) Clicking Participate in Survey from the Notification Center will now open the survey in an external browser.

Bug Fixes

Gameplay

  • Fixed an issue where the interaction range at gas stations differed between TPP and FPP.
  • Fixed an issue where the Adrenaline Syringe pickup sound played incorrectly.
  • Fixed an issue where goggles on certain Level 2 helmets were visible above the water while swimming underwater.
  • Fixed an issue where your backpack could block your view when looking behind while riding a bicycle in FPP.
  • Fixed an issue in UGC Mode where placing a certain building would also place oil drums.
  • Fixed an issue where the ‘No-Fly Zone’ medal could be earned by defeating enemies in certain conditions.

World

  • Fixed collision, texture, performance, and some other general Paramo issues.
  • Fixed an issue on Rondo where firework sounds didn’t scale correctly with distance.

UX/UI

  • Fixed an issue where disabling login notifications didn’t work when a clan member (not on your friends list) entered the lobby.
  • Fixed an issue where a squad member’s profile could display incorrectly in the lobby after forming a team.
  • (PC) Fixed an issue where banned players saw the secondary password prompt instead of the ban message when entering the lobby.
  • (PC) Fixed an issue where parts of a waypoint could remain on-screen in Observer Mode after removing it.
  • (PC) Fixed an issue where the aiming/sound practice results UI could be cut off in Training Grounds on certain aspect ratios.

Items & Skins

Clipping issue: Graphics that are shown outside the visible part of an image/object.

  • Fixed an issue where the hat from the Stay Frosty Head skin could float when worn with the Thermal Protection Suit.
  • Fixed a clipping issue on the character’s back when a female character wearing the Nightclub Dress with the QBZ Schematic Sweatshirt.
  • Fixed clipping on the back of the head when equipping the Porsche Socialite Hat on the G-DRAGON character skin.
  • Fixed a clipping issue around the ankles when wearing Pigff’s Tactical Striker Pants with Donut Mess With Me Sneakers.
  • Fixed an issue where the female character’s hands became transparent when wearing Wicked Waddle Bodysuit with PGC 2021 Contingent Chaos Jacket.
  • Fixed a clipping issue affecting footwear when using emotes while wearing G-DRAGON’s Boots with the Pillar Security Uniform (male character).
  • Fixed an issue where a hairband could appear through/above the hood when wearing the PKL Hoodie on male characters.

The full Update 40.1 PUBG Patch Notes can be found here.

item.title: GTA Online Support Will Seemingly Continue After GTA 6 Launch
item.content:encoded:
Take-Two CEO has put fans’ minds at ease, revealing that they have “every reason to believe” GTA Online will continue after the GTA 6 launch.

Grand Theft Auto 6, the next mainline title for the wildly popular Rockstar Games series, is all set to release in November 2026, and the developers have recently reaffirmed the date as well. However, with the new instalment on the way, players have been wondering whether the online services of the previous title will sunset after GTA 6’s launch.

Take Two Has ‘Every Reason’ to Continue GTA Online Support Once GTA 6 Arrives

During the most recent earnings call, Take-Two CEO Strauss Zelnick responded to an investor’s question about the support for GTA Online. Zelnick expressed strong confidence in the service’s ongoing support, stating that they have “every reason to believe” it will continue. He emphasized that the game has a “great community” that remains engaged, and noted that Rockstar has demonstrated how the title can remain relevant for years after its release, thanks to the high-quality additional content.

Interested readers can check out Strauss Zelnick’s complete statement below:

“At the same time, I have every reason to believe we’ll continue to support GTA Online. There’s a great community that loves it, that stays engaged. And again, in this quarter, Rockstar has shown that when you deliver great additional content, despite how long GTA Online has been in the market, people show up.”

GTA Online has been around for more than a decade and is still a top contender in the games industry. On Steam alone, GTA 5 is able to bring in more than 100,000 players daily, and that’s almost all thanks to the Online service. What’s more, it was just announced that GTA 5 has sold 225 million copies worldwide, and GTA Online contributed significantly to that as well.

In discussing the title, Zelnick pointed out that the Grand Theft Auto series has “vastly outpaced” their forecasts. This impressive performance can be attributed to a “recurrent spending growth of 27%,” driven by the latest update for GTA Online, titled “A Safehouse in the Hills.” This update introduced new mansion properties and marked the return of the game’s protagonist, Michael DeSanta.

In other news, GTA 6 marketing will begin this summer and will have a physical edition. Additionally, GenAI has zero part in the upcoming title. item.title: Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth To Be Shown During Nintendo Direct, It’s Claimed
item.content:encoded:
Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth will be shown during Thursday’s Nintendo Direct event.

According to known leaker NateTheHate, Square Enix is expected to show the game during the Partner Direct on February 5. He adds that it’s also possible that they’ll announce a release date for the game as well.

“They will give it a release date and a brand-new trailer,” he said. “Last week it was reported that Square Enix was targeting a summer release for Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth on Switch 2 and Xbox. And to my understanding, that information is correct.”

He then said that he thinks that the game will release sometime in June.

Of course, despite his track record with rumors and reports, it’s important to take the latest claims with a grain of salt.

The Nintendo Direct Partner Showcase takes place at 9am ET/6am PT on February 5. It will focus on games from external developers coming to both Nintendo Switch and Nintendo Switch 2.

item.title: NYT Connections Hints Today (#970)—Clues and Answers for Thursday, February 5
item.content:encoded:
It’s a special day for this NYT Connections hints guide, because today is my birthday! It’s nice to celebrate in many ways, but today I’m welcoming my most recent trip around the sun by helping you solve today’s NYT Connections puzzle. Below, you’ll find the hints and solutions you need to get this puzzle completed as quickly as possible.

Read on to learn what you need to know, and perhaps leave me a ‘Happy birthday!’ in the comments below!

What is NYT Connections?

It would be remiss of me not to give a little foundational backstory before leaping into today’s NYT Connections clues and hints.

In June 2023, NYT Connections emerged as yet another game in the ever-growing New York Times lineup. This title soared immediately, and it’s easy to see why. As a free-to-play, accessible New York Times game, NYT Connections is available to users worldwide and can be played on either desktop devices or via a mobile app.

Playing NYT Connections on your commute or while waiting for a coffee is a fantastic way to kill a few minutes.

But how do you play NYT Connections?

It’s relatively simple, and that’s why it’s the best New York Times game, in my opinion.

The NYT team will provide you with a grid of 16 words once a day. The only task left up to you is to sort those words into four groups of four by finding their commonalities. Every NYT Connections puzzle has just one solution, and some words might have a double meaning, so it can sometimes be tricky to figure out the answers.

It’s also important to stress that the words are color-coded: yellow, blue, green, and purple. That’s in order of difficulty from least to most difficult, too.

What’s critical here is that you get four guesses every day, and if you use those, your NYT Connections answers for today will be out of reach, as it’ll be game over.

Today’s NYT Connections Hints (February 5)

If you want to figure out today’s NYT Connections clues without getting the answers outright, I’ll start with the words themselves. Perhaps just seeing the words here will prompt your brain to take action, and you’ll spot the trends immediately.

And here are the hints I can offer for today’s NYT Connections:

Here’s the final warning before we get to the NYT Connections answers for today, February 5:

NYT Connections Answers Explained for Today, February 5 (#970)

If you want to jump straight to the answers for today’s NYT Connections puzzle, I’ve got you covered:

item.title: WD To Release A 100TB Hard Drive By 2029
item.content:encoded:
WD wants you to never have to by another storage device again. The digital storage company—also known as Western Digital—announced its new High Bandwidth Drive and Dual Pivot technology.

The Dual Pivot technology, WD says, will add a second set of “independently operating actuators on a separate pivot and will deliver up to 2x sequential IO gain within a 3.5-inch drive.”

“This differs from previous dual actuator designs that sacrificed capacity and required extensive customer software changes,” WD says. “Dual Pivot enables reduced spacing between disks, allowing for more platters per drive and higher overall capacity.”

The High Bandwidth Drive will allow simultaneous writing and reading from multiple heads on multiple tracks. This technology, according to WD, will offer double the bandwidth of standard HDDs without any power setbacks.

“The technology has a clear path to scale up to 8x bandwidth gains and is already in customer hands for validation,” they said.

With the new technologies, and others that continue to improve, WD has plans to scale its HDD offerings in a major way over the next few years. The company has already announced its 40TB UltraSMR ePMR HDD that will enter production in the second half of 2026.

After the 40TB drive comes a 60TB offering before moving to 100TB by 2029.

“The result is unprecedented flexibility,” they say. “Hyperscalers and enterprises can adopt either technology on their own timelines with predictable capacity planning and seamless scaling – no forced technology transitions, no infrastructure disruptions, just continuous and accelerating capacity growth built on architecture they already trust.”
